Heya and welcome to the ECB Rua!

a) If what you wanted is a spellcaster build (as in your initial request - i gather) then you could do better than mix Pale master after 20 solid levels of Wizard. You would be too close to be undispellable and get epic bonus feats to do that now. If you want a Wizard/ Palemaster you need 40 levels to do it properly. Of course if that is what you need (for Rp purposes-OR not), then we could do it.

b) If what you want is an RDD, then the classic and very strong combo (Ftr/ Bard/ RDD) will do that and more. One of the strongest builds available on any level of play.

c) Have you seen the other lvl 30 builds that are in that section of the forums? Here are some of mine,

Knight Of The Throne: (Ftr 10/ RoG 5/ CoT 15) - Classic Knight, specifically build for AMIA Rp server --> http://nwnecbguild.forumer.com/topic/23 ... KsrSXtS38M
Death From a Thousand Cuts: (Ftr 16/ Bard 4/ RDD 10) - Two-Weapon Fighting build with good defences --> http://nwnecbguild.forumer.com/topic/23 ... Kss5ntS38M
Twice The Attack - Double The Guarantee: (Ftr 12/ Bard 2/ Wm 16) - This one just melt things down quickly --> http://nwnecbguild.forumer.com/topic/23 ... KstVntS38M

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Hail and well met!

Here's yet another idea: Cleric / Bard / RDD. You would have lots of Cleric buffs, some Bard skill-dumps, and all the RDD goodies. It would be basically a 30-level version of Blood and Faith:
http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 43768.html
If you're interested, I could put a 30-level version together for you.

If you want a Fighter / Bard / RDD, there are options. You could go Bard-heavy for more buffs and a better song, or Fighter-heavy for more feats and a higher BAB. With either Fighter or Cleric, you could go sword-and-board to get the AC from a shield, or go two-handed to deal more damage (and receive more damage, too, because of the loss of shield AC).

Rua Blackmist wrote:
Yeah, for my role-play I'm trying to do a mischievous and fun loving person :3. So, I thought bard initial would be good. Though, freezing everyone in stone as a druid, can be dirty huh xD
Like Valerfor says, bards are resourceful characters power wise, once you understand how to play them and how to build with the class.
They can also be very fun to roleplay. IMO roleplaying bards is not restricted to musicians and entertainers only. They can be played as different charismatic rogue types as well. They can be gatherers of lore, or spies and secret agents, and it doesn't stop there. They can be mages, soldiers, scribes, skalds, merchants and ADVENTURERS. This is a fantasy game, and IMO fantasy is the only limitation to what you can roleplay.
I have played many bards. One bard I played on a PW was trying to become a violinist. There can be much roleplay revolving around that, and I enjoyed roleplaying that character, much because of the depth of character that developed after roleplaying with other good roleplayers for some time. Well, anyway he was very bad at playing the violin, terribly bad, and he was well known for that. So whenever he equipped the violin (CEP item) and started playing, he played the curse song.
